node.title: Anxious wait for rain-soaked NSW residents facing possible evacuation as Lachlan River swells
node.alt: A flood marker can be seen in muddy brown water below an iron bridge
node.description: Evacuation orders are possible in Forbes, as the Lachlan River continues to rise after heavy rainfall in central New South Wales.
node.content:
["An anxious wait is unfolding for residents of the New South Wales Central West, as authorities watch rising floodwaters and wait to decide whether an evacuation order needs to be issued.", "At Forbes, the Lachlan River is expected to reach 9.50 metres this morning, and a peak of around 10.55 metres tomorrow morning.", "If that happens, an evacuation may be ordered for properties likely to be affected.", "\"We're not going to evacuate the entire township, we are only going to concentrate on the people who are likely to be inundated by floodwater,\" SES incident controller Barry Griffiths said.", "\"We're trying to really to tailor our evacuation if it's required to the lay of the land and what the floodwater's doing,\" Mr Griffiths said.", "", "
The massive Wyangala Dam near Cowra is spilling thousands of litres of water into the Lachlan River.(ABC Central West: Xanthe Gregory)
", "An evacuation warning was issued last night, to give residents the heads-up on the potential decision.", "Properties anticipated to be in danger are those south of Bathurst street, east of Ooma and Ferry streets, between Lake Forbes and Ooma Street, in parts of North Forbes and the CBD, north-east of the Forbes Railway, north of the Newell Highway and in West Forbes, west of Wambat Street.", "Forbes, with its normally picturesque riverside views, is no stranger to floods.", "The SES has warned\u00a0the water could reach the height of the devastating September 2016 flood, which caused millions of dollars of damage to farmland and crops around the Shire.", "\"Historically, Forbes has always had different levels of flooding and different phenomenon when it comes to floodwater,\" Mr Griffiths said.", "\"In 2012 floodwater moved through the town, in 2016 it didn't move through the town, so exactly what the water does is kind of like flip a coin.\"", "The flood is being exacerbated by the release\u00a0of thousands of megalitres from the Wyangala Dam upstream and the swollen Lachlan tributary, the Belubula River.", "The SES said the Lachlan peaked at Cowra overnight\u00a0at 12.64 metres.", "Major flooding is occurring at Nanami, which is expected to peak at 12.20 metres this afternoon. If that happens, it will be higher than the September 2016 flood.", "Preparation for the water is in full swing, with the local football club\u00a0helping the sandbagging efforts.", "", "
SES incident controller Barry Griffiths says\u00a0floodwaters are likely to hit\u00a0low lying parts of Forbes.(ABC Central West: Xanthe Gregory)
"]
